```
⋊> ~ stty -a                                                                                                                                                                              13:58:54
speed 38400 baud; rows 51; columns 194; line = 0;
intr = ^C; quit = ^\; erase = ^?; kill = ^U; eof = ^D; eol = <undef>; eol2 = <undef>; swtch = <undef>; start = ^Q; stop = ^S; susp = ^Z; rprnt = ^R; werase = ^W; lnext = ^V; discard = ^O;
min = 1; time = 0;
-parenb -parodd -cmspar cs8 -hupcl -cstopb cread -clocal -crtscts
-ignbrk -brkint -ignpar -parmrk -inpck -istrip -inlcr -igncr icrnl -ixon -ixoff -iuclc -ixany -imaxbel iutf8
opost -olcuc -ocrnl onlcr -onocr -onlret -ofill -ofdel nl0 cr0 tab0 bs0 vt0 ff0
isig icanon iexten echo echoe echok -echonl -noflsh -xcase -tostop -echoprt echoctl echoke -flusho -extproc
```

### Steps to reproduce

I've created both `W1.norg` and `W2.norg` files with neotree, as seen in the screenshot, then when my cursors was at one of these files(don't remember which) i tried to move back to `index.norg` with `<C-w>l`, my neovim crashed.

I tried a few times to reproduce this but coudn't. All i can provide is the backtrace

### Expected behavior

.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-2216+g2cd76a758

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

.

### Operating system/version

6.7.2-arch1-2

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.31.0

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/neovim-nightly-bin

comment_data.body:
> I've created both `W1.norg` and `W2.norg` files with neotree, as seen in the screenshot, then when my cursors was at one of these files(don't remember which) i tried to move back to `index.norg` with `<C-w>l`, my neovim crashed.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/26155 is also a neotree related crash. Since this issue doesn't provide a different repro steps maybe we can consider this a duplicate.

Also getting the same error/crash after updating to recent commits. When opening a rather large `.norg` file, even from CLI without `Neo-Tree`:

```
nvim: /var/tmp/portage/app-editors/neovim-9999/work/neovim-9999/src/nvim/ui_compositor.c:546: ui_comp_raw_line: Assertion `attrs[i] >= 0' failed.
```

No issue with `nvim -u NONE file.norg`

```console
$ nvim -v
NVIM v0.10.0-dev-2264+gbe1d09c42-dirty
```

I had the same problem, so I went back to the commits and I thought it was occurring from this commit (https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/c6864b0d146f017990d6feb8c876784160a25241).

Also, with this setting, it no longer reproduces.

```lua
vim.o.relativenumber = false
```
I think that's a different issue, as OP's screenshot doesn't have 'relativenumber'.
It may be a different problem, but there is a case that `vim.o.relativenumber` is enabled and `vim.o.statuscolumn` is set.

> I had the same problem, so I went back to the commits and I thought it was occurring from this commit ([c6864b0](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/c6864b0d146f017990d6feb8c876784160a25241)).
> 
> Also, with this setting, it no longer reproduces.
> 
> ```lua
> vim.o.relativenumber = false
> ```

Disabling `vim.o.relativenumber` doesn't help on my end. I'm not using `vim.o.statuscolumn`.
@yutkat Please open another issue with a backtrace.

I have same issue. but i can't create minimum reproduce setting.
`ui_comp_raw_line` errors occurs when
- opening markdown file (e.g. [my repo README.md](https://github.com/mimikun/dotfiles/blob/master/README.md) ) 
- run `:checkhealth`, type 'zR' (open fold) and hold `j` key.

```
54  nvim: /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/ui_compositor.c:546: ui_comp_raw_line: Assertion `attrs[i] >= 0' fail
```

labels.description: We need minimal steps to reproduce the issue
labels.name: needs:repro

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: crash with .norg files: __assert_fail "attrs[i] >= 0"
